rComments: Joy Hagen was a woman that extracted the joy out of writing entirely. I despised this woman. A waste of my time entirely. Throughout my 20 weeks with her I hoped she wouldn't save 15% or more on car insurance from Geico.

Joy was a pretty nice and chill professor. When I went to her for feedback on my papers, she was really helpful but sometimes the assignments did confuse me. Overall I did enjoy being in her classes because she was always happy and had a positive attitude.

shes super chill and really nice. Talks for days and all the essay topics can seem very redundant and mundane. Overall, easy to get a good a grade and she accepts late work for days. Boring, but easy A. Nothing to it but to do it

Joy is a nice lady who really wants to help you write better. Her teaching style is that you rewrite an essay until it is college-level writing. Me personally, I had to rewrite all of them several times. It can be a pain but after the fact I can say I'm a better writer because of her.

Mrs. Hagen is relaxed with work, doesnt care if it is late which is nice. She is unclear with what is due and how to do it so youre usually better off asking other classmates. Shes overall fairly nice and gives you chocolate for writing groups in her office :)
Take her for both writing classes she is extremely easy and helpful. Everything is done in groups (peer reviews, etc.) Topics may be boring but the work is easy.

Joy is a great writing teacher. She never vocalized a problem with me being late, but missing a section did hurt because it usually meant I missed a critical lesson. Revisions throughout the quarter are really what make your grade. Joy is awesome! Way flexible and considerate of the fact that we have lives outside writing class.

I actually really enjoyed this class. She's very very chill. You can turn in your assignments late and as long as it shows you made an effort, she'll give you a good grade. She's always available to help, and even has goodies in her office for visitors. Writing 2 was a breeze with her.

she is aight she gets off topic but she is really nice and explains everything to the bone class doesnt require any readings whatsoever cus all the work is done in groups so you dont have to do it. def take her class for writing she is nicer than most of the other writing teachers my roommate writes twice as much as in his WRT 2 class

Joy is nice, but tends to get off topic in class. Overall I would say the class was easy, but there is a lot of work, and mostly done outside of class. A lot of what she lectures on doesn't seem to be relevant, but sometimes it helps. Half the time we don't really do anything in class.

Got stuck with "Joy" for the W2 writing class.  She decided to focus our writings on Bioethics.  While the general subject is interesting, the readings are dry and she's even worse.  Instead of teaching, she puts students in "groups to discuss."  Discuss what, Joy?  How bad this class is?

I really liked the material in this course and how it was presented.  Professor Hagen tried to make you think about the material during lecture.  The grading was too hard and I was disappointed in my grades.  The material was probably presented in too much depth for this course.  I would recommend you take this professor again.
Joy is disorganized but nice.  The material was easy but the test and grading was hard.

joy is really nice but is an extremely hard grader, but offers a lot of extra credit so if you get at least a C, those extra credit will boost you to an A, which is what I got. the books were only for the midterm,there were lot of guest speakers after the midterm so that was what we were tested on for the final. 4 study q's totaling to 40% of grade

Joy was a really sweet lady.  Her class was extremely dense though.  There was TONS of material and the midterm and final q's were really hard.  Everyone got D's on the midterm and she thought it was ok...She did offer 40 points of xtra credit though and the study q's were easy to get good scores on

Her first name is Joy, but she will suck all the joy out of you for each hour and 45 min lecture. One of the worse teachers I've ever had. Takes what could be an interesting subject and makes it extremely boring. Uses concepts/terms in lecture that she hasn't explained and that aren't in the readings, and doesn't clarify them when asked to. AVOID!!

Joy Hagen is, by far, the single worst teacher I have ever had. Her talks are horribly unorganized and she cannot present information in a comprehensible way. At one point an undergrad STUDENT raised his hand and explained in 1 sentence what Hagen was struggling to say for almost 20 mins. She also has absolutely no control over the class. STAY AWAY

Her lectures are totally out of order, her voice is monotonous and she is very, very boring. She means well, but she truly should not be teaching. Tests are hard but with the curve, everyone does a whole letter grade better than they got.
